intro: Thesium quinqueflorum, commonly known as the five-flowered thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which is also known as the yellow rocket family. The plant is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Thesium quinqueflorum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
